{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with secondary amenorrhea, which is the absence of menstruation after previously having regular menstrual cycles. The FSH level of 6 IU/mL is within the normal range. Ovarian failure, which is characterized by elevated FSH levels, can be ruled out. Pituitary failure, which would result in low FSH levels, can also be ruled out. Ongoing pregnancy is unlikely since the patient had a spontaneous abortion. Uterine synechiae, which refers to adhesions or scar tissue in the uterus, is not a common cause of secondary amenorrhea. Therefore, the most probable cause of amenorrhea in this case is A. Ovarian failure.", "answer_choice": "A"}
